result.execSummary:
The defendant Brady K. Kaufman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED: sentence credit of 0 days per 1/28/19 Order
Concurrent with: 14CF1043- Count 1 (and consecutive to any other sentence currently serving)

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full-time schedule of work and/or school.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal, or mind-altering substances.
No driving without a valid license.

Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Undergo psychological assessment and follow-through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: extended supervision in 14CF1043- Count 1
